task_summary: The robot locates, approaches, and grasps a red cylindrical object from the table.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a tabletop pick task, where a robotic arm must find and pick up a red cylindrical object positioned on a black table alongside blue markers. The robot visually detects the object, aligns from above, lowers gently until contact, grasps, verifies the grip, and slightly lifts the object. Constraints include gentle force, precise alignment, and robust object detection. The task emphasizes perception and compliant grasping.
preconditions: Red cylindrical object is placed on the table within reachable workspace.
Robot is initialized and gripper is open.
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the red object or attempt a grid scan if not seen.
Open the gripper to an adequate width.
Move the end-effector above the red object.
Approach and align with the object.
Lower slowly until contact is detected.
Close the gripper with moderate force.
success_criteria: Red object is securely held by the gripper.
No object slippage detected after lift.
No damage or displacement of unintended objects.
failure_and_recovery: If object not visible, retry scan procedure up to three attempts.
If grasp is unstable, restart from open gripper and realignment.
If contact is not detected within lowering phase, abort and report.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the object is firmly grasped and lifted above the table surface.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visible to the robot's perception system.
Scans the workspace in a grid pattern to locate the red object.
Detects and localizes the red object using sensors.
Opens the gripper to fit the red object.
Moves the end-effector above the red object.
Approaches and aligns with the red object to prepare for grasping.
Lowers the gripper slowly until contact is detected.
Closes the gripper to grasp the red object with moderate force.
Verifies the grasp on the red object is stable.
Retracts the gripper with the object held.

recovery_strategy: Retry grid scan up to 3 times if not visible.
Re-align and re-attempt approach if alignment or contact fail.
Retry gripper closure if grasp not stable.
assumptions: Red object in instruction matches red cylinder in frames.
Table surface clear; only one plausible red object in the workspace.
No explicit placement/pick target pose given, so 'red_object' and 'table' suffices.

expected_success_criteria: Red object lifted securely from table
Object remains in gripper after retreat
